html: Mason led a third wade-in protest at the beach in spring 1963, two weeks after the funeral for Medgar Evers. The protesters faced a much larger group of nearly 2000 white protesters, but this time the police prevented violence against them.

html: During her time participating in the Civil Rights Movement, she was jailed over 70 times because of her role in civil rights protests and other actions. She was elected mayor of Mayersville, MS in 1976, making her the first female African-American mayor in Mississippi.
text:
During her time participating in the Civil Rights Movement, she was jailed over 70 times because of her role in civil rights protests and other actions.
She was elected mayor of Mayersville, MS in 1976, making her the first female African-American mayor in Mississippi.

html: Later that year, she became a member of the executive committee of the Mississippi Freedom Democratic Party. In late August, she and 67 other elected Mississippi Freedom Democratic Party delegates traveled to the 1964 Democratic National Convention.
text: Later that year, she became a member of the executive committee of the Mississippi Freedom Democratic Party. In late August, she and 67 other elected Mississippi Freedom Democratic Party delegates traveled to the 1964 Democratic National Convention.

html: She first got involved in the Civil Rights Movement in June 1964, when two activists from SNCC came to Mayersville. After meeting Fannie Lou Hamer in the summer of 1964 and hearing her experiences in the Civil Rights Movement, Blackwell decided to join the SNCC.

text:
The Senate is expected to vote today to make Thomas Farr a federal judge in North Carolina.

Who is Thomas Farr? For starters, he was a lawyer for then-Senator Jesse Helms’ campaign, where he defended the campaign in its efforts to disenfranchise African American voters.
